text:
Are you the type of person who likes airport
layovers? I didn't think so.

Today I'm going to share with you my top five
travel tips for surviving the airport layovers.

There aren't many people who like airport
layovers. I happen to be a freak because I

actually really do dig them. That is because
I actually planned my layovers as kind of

an extended trip so I kind of make it bearable
for myself. But I'm going to share with you

some of my tips to make it a lot more pleasant
and convenient for you.

See if there any overnight sleeping cabins.
 There's a website called Sleeping in Airports

that I encourage you to check out. It shows
you what airports are good to sleep at if

you have to do that. Basically, travelers
leave reviews about the airport and where

are they found a place to sleep in. I'll leave
the link down below. Some airports actually

have sleeping cabins or lounge chairs. A lot
of times they don't have lounge chairs and

instead they have bars on the chairs so you
can't really lay out.

Next leave your bags with left luggage.  It's
where you can store your bags for anything

and anywhere from a few hours to a couple
days .  That helps you to free your hands

so that you can hop a bus or a metro into
the city and do some sightseeing. Prices vary

according to airports but they generally run
anywere from three to $10 for a days worth.

Wear comfortable clothes. That should be
a given actually, but the same time there's

a lot of people that want to look nice, presentable,
respectable because you never know who you're

going to meet you. At the same time, if you
know you're going to have a layover, I'd dress

for comfort. That could mean anywhere from
bringing a jacket to like I said in one of

my videos bring arm warmers or like warmers
or a scarf just to stay comfortable and warm,…

cozy!  I've seen people go as far as wearing
sweatpants for a trip and it's all about comfort!

Bring your charging devices. These days it's
a technology-oriented society. Most of us

have iPhones, laptops, MP3 players, cameras…
You're gonna want to take the time to charge

them. Also, if the airport has Wi-Fi and you
wanna be surfing on your laptop, definitely
bring your charging devices with you.

Always pack a bag of essential items and I'm
talking … underwear, makeup, toothpaste,

toothbrush, jacket ... these are some things
that you want to have to make your stay comfortable.

And you might want to freshen up along the
way.  Your flight get delayed or your bags

could get lost, anyway it's always good to
have a bag full of stuff that's gonna allow
you to survive the trip.

If  you enjoy this video, keep an eye out
for the next video, which is about how to

choose your airport layover. Be sure to share
your comments below. If you have any recommendations
of how to survive
an airport layover, leave them down below.
